content.question: The narrator’s insistence in lines 3-6 that he is “alone” and “neither lov’d nor known,” that “none care,” and that he is “no Soul’s Concern” is called into question by which of the following lines?

choices.label: “Without a Tear will tend my Herse” (line 8)
“those who tend the Sick for pay” (line 17)

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Explain how a narrator's reliability affects a narrative.
